sub_topic: Coordination chemistry of metalloenzymes and metalloproteins
message_1: What is the coordination number and geometry of the iron ion in the heme group of the myoglobin protein?
message_2: The coordination number of the iron ion (Fe) in the heme group of the myoglobin protein is 6. The geometry of the iron ion in the heme group is octahedral. In this arrangement, the iron ion is coordinated to four nitrogen atoms from the porphyrin ring in a planar configuration, one nitrogen atom from the imidazole side chain of the histidine residue, and one oxygen atom from the bound oxygen molecule (O2).
